Deficiency Narrative: During the course of this investigation when reviewing documents, it was stated by caregiver and residents that the caregiver used inappropriate language around children in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation came into compliance by conducting a meeting on 7/30/2025 regarding profane language and prudent parent standard and provided meeting notes with all staff signatures.

Deficiency Narrative:
Two children went from a verbal altercation to a physical altercation. One child
required a hospital visit. There was no reported called in to Licensing.
Correction Narrative:
The operation came into compliance by having a meeting with the team that covers IRs and being on call covered reasons for calling in incidents, looking at specific standards, and how they should be documented in the Incident Reports. the operation also required staff to take trainings that address different areas of building connections with clients and managing the milieu and building 
positive culture amongst staff and clients. The operation also requires all staff on the Wedgwood Campus to take 3 trainings for EBI Refresher.

Deficiency Narrative: At the time of inspection, there were no visible policies regarding the BARK app. The electronic rules and agreement did not reference the installation of the BARK app on the electronic devices of children in care. Additionally, the children's services plans did not stipulate the requirement for the BARK app to be installed on all such devices. The electronic rules and agreement were brought in compliance after the investigation intake on 4/23/2024 when the agreement form was updated.
Correction Narrative: The operation came into compliance by submitting signed Electronic Rules and Agreement forms signed by all children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver who was responsible for caring for children fell asleep while they were on duty and caring for children in care.
Correction Narrative: Operation immediately terminated the caregiver ad stated that We are thoroughly training the staff and are really emphasizing, to the wake at night staff, that falling asleep on the job is failing to meet the needs of the clients and is an immediately terminable offense. The staff in this incident was terminated for cause. We are also increasing the frequency of checks from the overnight shift supervisor. The Wedgwood campus has increased the auditing of video by the program supervisors to make sure children are being supervised. This employee was operating outside of the trained parameters and expectations of the job. The checks and balances put in place at the agency caught the issue and allowed us to remedy the situation and part ways with the employee.

Deficiency Narrative: A Youth Care supervisor did not perform a body scan on a  high risk child who was known to self-harm after blood was found in the childs  bathroom.
Correction Narrative: To ensure compliance with the above-mentioned standard, a corrective action plan will be written for the youth care supervisor (YCS). The YSC will be retrained on the ACH suicide prevention policy and re-reread  and acknowledge safety plans for all Behavioral Care clients. Staff will utilize shift huddles, daily emails and the shift change check sheets to communicate concerning behaviors among clients. Staff will be able to seek support and guidance from ACH on-call for immediate concerns

Deficiency Narrative: A youth care specialist who was standing next to two children in care, failed to intervene when the two children in care got into a physical altercation. Another youth care specialist that was several yards away had to run over and intervene and a third youth care specialist also had to run over to help. While the youth care specialist that was next to the two children stood back and did not intervene or assist the other two youth care specialists.
Correction Narrative: To ensure compliance with the above-mentioned standard, a corrective action plan will be written for the mentioned youth care specialist (YCS), following disciplinary action. Staff will be retrained on when and how to intervene during client conflicts to ensure client safety. Staff will utilize shift huddles, daily emails and the shift change check sheets to communicate concerning behaviors and client safety at the beginning and end of every shift. Staff will be able to seek support and guidance from ACH on-call for immediate concerns.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the two child files reviewed showed that the child's prescription medication was not picked up from the pharmacy timely and the child missed their dosage.
Correction Narrative: To ensure compliance with the above-mentioned standard and ensure that medication is picked up timely and distributed as prescribed going forward, the ACH nurse will conduct weekly audits by reviewing the electronic medical record to notate distribution of medications as prescribed. An assigned Wedgewood staff will complete weekly audits to notate medication counts and refills needed. Once a medication hits 14 pills, the Case Manager/Treatment Director will need to be notified. This will ensure that the case manager has enough time to reach out to the providers to request a refill, schedule or adjust appointments, and ensure that medications are delivered on time through Pharmerica Pharmacy. Staff will inform the Case Manager/Treatment Director and document through their shift daily emails and medication management TEAMS channels the expiring medication and medication count until a new prescription is delivered. The medication had already been picked up on the day of the monitoring inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the two child files did not have the medication records from December, January, or February. The operation switched to digital files at the end of February.
Correction Narrative: The operation switched to digital files in February 2023 and are in the process of scanning all documents into the system.

Deficiency Narrative: Incident reports do not include the physical address or the telephone number.
Correction Narrative: Operation director emailed me a copy of the updated incident report. The report now includes a place to document the address and the telephone number.

Deficiency Narrative: A child was not taken promptly to receive medical care.
Correction Narrative: A follow up inspection was conducted at the operation (Inspection #3894687). Operation treatment director was interviewed regarding the plan for ensuring medical treatment is obtained timely. The operation will talk to children involved in the incident to determine if they need medical attention. If the child is in need of medical attention for an injury or illness the operation will immediately take the child to their PCP, Urgent Care or if it is after hours or the operation is unable to get to the child into the doctor's office they will take them to Cook's Children Emergency Room.

Deficiency Narrative: A child with a history of high risk behaviors for sexually acting out was not adequately supervised by staff.
Correction Narrative: Operation administrator emailed the safety plan that was implemented on 6/24/2021. The plan includes several requirements such as closer supervision, education on inappropriate contact/boundaries, outings, and reporting/documentation. The staff member involved in this investigation no longer works at the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: Training certificates for EBI and CPR/First Aid in one employee file do not include the trainers qualifications.
Correction Narrative: Operation administrator emailed and stated that they implemented a new learning management system and are working with the developers to correct the certificates that are awarded, to ensure that all certificates include the essential elements including the trainers qualifications. Certificate for the one employee have been corrected and now includes the trainers qualifications.

Deficiency Narrative: One medication log did not include the month and year and one medication log noted the incorrect month.
Correction Narrative: Operation administrator emailed and stated that the program supervisors completed a campus medication documentation audit to ensure all documentation was correct. The program supervisors will now audit medication documentation logs at the beginning of each month to ensure that the documentation is correct.

Deficiency Narrative: Two caregivers picked up a child by the wrists and legs and carried her to another room.
Correction Narrative: Operation director stated that the staff member had been on suspension since the beginning of the investigation and has been terminated due to the results of the investigation. A staff meeting was held with the remaining staff on 12/2/2020 that addressed the use of emergency behavior intervention, prohibited discipline measures, and the proper use of discipline and short personal restraints.  The staff reviewed in depth the standard and ACH policy and procedures regarding discipline and emergency behavior intervention as well as childÂ’s rights. The staff also completed SAMA refreshers supporting their effective use of our emergency behavior intervention for containment if it becomes necessary to use it.  They completed those trainings on December 8th and December 15th.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver at the operation dragged a 9 year old across the floor by her arm and legs which could have caused serious harm externally.
Correction Narrative: Operation director stated that the staff member had been on suspension since the beginning of the investigation and has been terminated due to the results of the investigation.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver last received EBI training on 11/1/2019 and has not received any additional training within the last 6 months.
Correction Narrative: Operation director stated that the staff member involved in the incident no longer works at the operation. This was verified in CLASS as the staff member was made inactive on 11/23/2020. A safety plan was implemented and requires all behavioral care staff to be retrained in Emergency Behavior Intervention Techniques by 1/13/2020.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver placed a child in an uncomfortable position by placing her arm around his neck and pulling his hair.
Correction Narrative: Operation director stated that the staff member involved in the incident no longer works at the operation. This was verified in CLASS as the staff member was made inactive on 11/23/2020. A safety plan was implemented and requires all behavioral care staff to be retrained in Emergency Behavior Intervention Techniques by 1/13/2021.
